reviews.review_msg: I really liked her as an instructor and I got a lot out of the course. It is an upper division course and involves a lot of reading but I think that if you follow all of this and read all relevant information before starting assignments, you will get the grade you want. Also when send her an e-mail if you're confused and she'll be happy to help.
grading and re-grading are not reasonable. She can edit your final grade with no reason. Marking is so harsh. rip to students who are taking her classes
Worst prof in GEOG department. No feedback at all, just give you(grade) what she want with no reason. Trash lecture slider. With no luck, you would not pass this course!!

I'm taking GEOG 312 as a distance ed course and I'm frustrated with it. The assignments and tutorials are so confusing and there aren't any clear directions. The graphs and diagrams provided are SO blurry and IMPOSSIBLE to read. Course leaves you frustrated. GEOG 312 would be better as an in-person course than distance ed. Do not recommend.
Not very helpful. Expects students to find answers by themselves. Very tough marker and not very forgiving or understanding.
Confusing. Lack of helpful direction. Vague instructions. Not sure if she wants to confuse intentionally. To have her as a professor is frustrating at best.

There were far too many assignments. I understand this is an upper-divison course, but weekly short essay write-ups is absurd. Very particular about following the (confusingly worded) directions for assignments. The material  is informative but I definitely would NOT recommend the class in the online format. Way too much work and very confusing.

Would not reply to emails or messages on Canvas. Extremely hard marking on the papers, and would not respond when I asked her for help. However she sent out a copy of the exam and allowed cheat sheets, so that salvaged my mark.
One of the worst courses I have ever taken. Doesn't provide help or feedback on assignments. Would not recommend.

Extremely tough marker, who doesn't give feedback on assignments.  She just sends out a rubric of what she expected after the fact.  Not to my satisfaction.  The only thing beneficial to this class was the tutorial assignments.
Nice Teacher but boring lecture. tutorials are ok, people only cried because they sucked so bad on their essay, i didn't even try that hard and got 70% and 85% on both essays
BEST PROF EVER.

She is an absolute sweetheart. She really cares for your success, and she will help you if you work hard. She reviews the papers before submission so prepared students do even better. Class is very boring though. She reads of slides, and attendance is taken each class. She is very friendly, and wants her students to succeed!

Maggie always has the biggest smile on her face. Her powerpoints ARE very text heavy and she does go through them quite fast, so it'd be nice if she recorded lectures but she posts slides online. Lots of readings but textbook info rarely comes up, though it's good to have for studying. Good course.

Like the others said, she does read off her slides the whole class - they're posted online but she does put in her own study into the lectures. I think she made the tutorial activities which were very straightforward but can drag on the tutorial. However I think her marking was far and the workload was manageable for a 300, non-Q course.

Reads directly from slides (which were not hers). Can tell it is not her area of expertise. No additional info given on slides. Goes so fast through powerpoint it is impossible to absorb let alone take notes. Really hard marker on papers. Seems like a nice lady though, and offers help.

The class itself was boring but she made it somewhat enjoyable. You can tell she really knows her stuff and enjoy teaching it. I was fortunate that she taught my tutorial section as well. It was a lot of fun. No stress in the tutorials. Very casual discussions. However, she is a hard marker on papers. Exams are easy.

Nice & knowledgeable professor. Lectures are also very interesting with a lot of YouTube videos. Unfortunately, his responses to e-mails & online notes are pretty slow and tutorials are run too loosely (one TA said he didn't know about the topic of the week until the night before). Expect A LOT of readings - I say focus on notes & text for exams

Really nice guy. Definitely knows his material. Likes to show youtube clips in class, as well as related class content to current natural disasters in the world. Midterm and exam were a bit left-field, but I think studying both his notes AND the textbook would achieve a higher grade.

Overall he's a really nice, straightforward guy and seems interested enough in the material, but when it comes down to it he is really disorganized. Expect marks/feedback on your midterms and projects far after the fact this semester it was a month. Note taking doesn't seem necessary until you realize the slides won't be posted in a timely manner.

Very nice, personable prof, he definitely likes the material. However, there's been some problems this semester. There is no reading list to tell us where we are in the text, which he rarely references if at all. And it has been a month and we haven't gotten our midterms back yet. Be warned that he lectures for the full 1hour 50mins with NO BREAK
Just want to say good luck to those who r taking this prof

This course is not difficult but Maggie seems to have a strict marking scheme (she really likes students to create their own tables/figs). If you consult her with your draft before handing it in she is so helpful! She tries hard to listen to students' suggestions so if you dont like something let her know. Lectures are pretty good.

I did not enjoy this course at all. She read from the slides during lecture because those are not her own slides. She is a super hard marker for papers. There are free% for participation and all the questions from the finals were given to us prior. There are two papers plus another one in final. She requires you to use ecology journal citation.
Very tough course with him. All the people giving him 5 stars are either lying or got lucky with there group members. Work load is way to much and grading is very tough.
Worst Professor, there are so many assignments per week and he is a very tough grader. Dont take this course with him..

Took this online as an elective and it's honestly not bad. Yes, there's a ton of short assignments/mini projects each week but you honestly just need 2 days to do the (easy) readings then input all your answers for the questions he provides beforehand. Intersession so it's really just 6 weeks of putting up with this if you want 4 credits.

Andrew is kind and accessible. However, the tutorial assignments we have to do each week require over 6 to 7 hours PLUS we have to sometimes do components of a project on top of that. However, given that this is an intersession course, it is somewhat understandable (even though my other intersessions do not require nearly as much work).
Took as an online course and his format of teaching style was great. Easy and straightforward to understand. Participation made sure you stay concentrated on the materials for exam.

Student would work 7-12 hours for one assignment, but the outcome is only 4-5%. You might get lost if you cannot reach prof and TA which they are relucantly to provide help. You wouldn't likely to get help from the TA as he don't follow the office hour schedule.

Online version of this course is just bad. Recycling all the videos from the previous year. Prof even avoids saying times in the introduction video to prevent another recording. Tutorials are a mess, there is a time limit for tutorials, you can see the questions but never know if it is short answer or MC until you throw yourself into the quiz.

Andrew is a phenomenal prof; his passion for geography is clearly illustrated through his energetic and informative lectures. If all GEOG classes at SFU were taught by Andrew I would, without a doubt, pursue GEOG as my major. I attended his lectures solely due to the fact that they were too interesting to miss. Basically a mini TED talk.

Andrew is very passionate about the lectures he gives, and always finds a way to make them interactive. Although he is a little cheesy at times, the effort he puts into classes makes it worth showing up. He makes connections with real-life examples of subject matter, making it easier to relate and follow along during lecture. Would def take again!
Awesome guy, you can tell that he is really passionate about what he is teaching which makes the class a lot better.

Lectures were quite informative. If you have taken all the required 200lv geog and below, most of the things youll learn will just make sense. Andrew was a pree cool guy and had great attitude towards students. The course felt like an elective. Exams are fair. Textbook is not completely necessary

Think he's a great Prof.I took geog 312 with him. Very knowledgeable . You can tell he is very interested in what he teaches. Lots of relevant examples from current and past events . Tests are fair and labs are a breeze as long as you are willing to put in the effort.

Ian is a funny prof but his TAs this semester were anal markers.  Exam questions were all essay format and too general, marks are hit or miss.  Project was somewhat fun.  Gotta go to tutorial to get marks.

Ian's awesome.  My favourite prof by far at SFU.  He's really  loves what he's doing and it really passes on to students.  He keeps his classes fun and engaging.  The text book is not necessary, but good for a reference
great lectures, with nice powerpoint slides. He was very clear with what is expected of you, and if you do just that you can do very well!
He sucks. He is stuck up and self centered. I hate his attitude and he takes marks off without any rationale. I think he makes sure to fail a certain amount of people each semester.
A great course.  Lots of interesting material and overall it's easy.  Knows a lot.
A challenging but fair course.
This course is a bad grade waiting to happen.
No Comments
